intro: Zehneria subcoriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved zehneria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves that are covered in a rough, textured layer. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Zehneria subcoriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
